body.p: However, some respondents were concerned that entities might have difficulty in exercising judgement when assessing the materiality of disclosures because:

li.p: there is no universal quantitative criterion for defined benefit plans for separating material disclosure items from immaterial ones; and

the notion of materiality seems best suited to a binary decision (whether to provide or omit a particular disclosure) and is not well suited to determining the extent of disclosure required to meet a disclosure requirement or to determining the overall balance with other disclosure requirements.
